Articles.Content:
Hey there guys,

I was working on a new spaceplane, and while it worked fine in the lower atmosphere, it got it's .... wrecked at 15ish clicks, when assymetric flameouts occurred and the craft would spin wildly out of control. I thought these things were 'fixed' in 1.0. Anyone knows how this may have happened?

EDIT:

Here's the ship file. [http://pastebin.com/5g4rprHp](http://pastebin.com/5g4rprHp)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-15T13:44:48Z" title="05/15/2015 01:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 15, 2015</time> by Rodyle**

It's looking more like this is still an issue. Fuel flows were specifically named as changed for 1.0, intake air assumed to be included, but perhaps not, or some other problem is getting in the way, idk. 

See pix in [this post by LordFjord](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116993-Helpful-1-0-observations?p=1936535&viewfull=1#post1936535), he has made a mod/fix that reassigns intakes... [follow this thread for info](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104704-1-0-2-Intake-Build-Aid).
It definitely still happens, not really fixed at all. Can still be minimized by interleaving placement of intakes/engines, or using LordFjord's excellent mod linked above.
